apis.description: Get the photos that have been added to the collection after a specific photo.

apis.description: Paginate through all collected photos.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number to offset into the photos collection and begin the returned data from.

parameters.description: The _id of a photo object to redirect to.

apis.description: Full-text search of all links

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search string

operations.notes: The query searches against the link, author, related contacts, title, and full page contents. Most of the Lucene query syntax is available.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The subset of fields to return.

parameters.description: When 1 or true the complete encounters array is included in the result.

apis.description: Get information about where a link was originally extracted from (a tweet, a Facebook wall post, etc).

operations.summary: Get the link information for a specific link.
operations.notes: A single link can have many encounters.  Encounters contain the information from the original sources such as tweets or Facebook wall posts.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The url of the link.  This is the fully expanded url when possible.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of encounters to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The order of the returned encounters. Currently this uses a MongoDB syntax.

apis.description: Get the links that have been added to the collection after a specific link.

parameters.description: The exclusive lower bound _id. Result array is all links added after that one.

apis.description: Query data.  This endpoint should not be used for trying to just get all data out of a collection, that's what the collection endpoints are for.  When utilizing the query API, you must specify both a type and at least one query parameter.

operations.summary: Query collection data.

parameters.name: dataSet
parameters.description: The data type to query.  Currently supported are Photo, Contact, Place, and Link.

parameters.name: terms
parameters.description:
The actual query to be performed.

Syntax

The syntax uses a JSON like notation that always begins as an array. The fields can be checked by writing them in a json notation of field:value. The field name can use dot notation to access objects that are deeper than the top level. The value can be a quoted string, a number, or 'true'/'false' (without quotes). Strings may be quoted with either " or '. Multiple terms can be checked by separating them with a comma just like a JSON array: [field:value, field2:value2]. Multiple terms are treated as an AND statement, in order to preform an OR search the terms that will be ORed are put in parenthesis and separated by OR statements. For example: [(field:value OR field2:value)]. AND is also available when necessary, following the same rules as the OR operator.The value can also contain comparison operators. Currently supported operators are:
  • + greater than
  • +. greater than or equal
  • - less than
  • -. less than or equal
  • != not equal
For example: [field:10+.] This searches for fields with a value of 10 or greater.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of entries to offset the returned data set to.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort the results on. Uses a mongo style syntax of '{"sortField":1}'. Note that it must be quoted.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The fields to return. This is an array of field names with a 1 to include them. The field name can use dot notation to access objects that are deeper than the top level. Exclusion is currently not possible, if a fields set is given that is all that will be returned. [field:1]

ready.description: true or 1 when the collection is ready to be interacted with (has data).

count.description: The number of items in the collection.

updated.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, that the collection was last updated.

lastId.description: The _id of the object last added to the collection. This is useful in conjunction with the /since endpoint.

_id.description: A unique identifier for this encounter.

_hash.description: A recreate-able, unique identifier based on the data.

at.description: The time, in milliseconds, that this encounter occurred.

from.description: The name of the contact this encounter came from.

fromID.description: The id, relative to the source service, of the contact that this encounter was from.

link.description: The full expanded URL that this encounter is related to.

network.description: The remote network that this encounter came from.

orig.description: The original form that this URL was encounterd.  This could be a shortened URL.

text.description: The original text where this link was found.

via.description: A service event that this encounter was found in.

_id.description: An auto-generated unique identifier for this link.

at.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, that the first encounter of this link was created.

embed.description: An object of oembed related information to create an embedded view of the link.

favicon.description: The URL of the favicon of the linked site.

text.description: The text of the page behind the link.

title.description: The title of the page behind the link.

encounters.description: An array of different "encounters" the person has had with a link - e.g. via a tweet and a Facebook post. Only returned if full == true.

_id.description: An auto-generated unique identifier for this photo.

height.description: Height of the photo in pixels.

sourceLink.description: A URL of an entity in which a link to the photo was originally encountered, e.g. a link to a tweet or a Facebook post that contained a link to the photo.

sources.description: An array of the services where this photo was encountered, e.g. a Facebook post or a tweet.

thumbnail.description: A URL to a thumbnail version of the photo.

timestamp.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, of when the photo was created.

url.description: The URL to the raw photo data.

width.description: The width of the photo in pixels.

_id.description: An auto-generated unique identifier for this contact.

accounts.description: An object of all the raw accounts that were collected together for this contact (Twitter, Facebook, etc).

addresses.description: An array of the street addresses this contact has stored.

firstnamesort.description: A helper field to support first name sorting.

lastnamesort.description: A helper field to support last name sorting.

name.description: The full name of this contact.

nicknames.description: An array of all the nicknames this contact is known by.

photos.description: An array of all of the profile photos associated with this contact.

_id.description: An auto-generated unique identifier for this place.

at.description: The date that this place was created.

id.description: The unique identifier for this place from the original source, e.g. Foursquare's id value.

me.description: Marked true if this place is something created by you, as opposed to your friends - i.e. is this my checkin or a friend's?.

network.description: The name of the network or source where this place record came from, e.g. foursquare.

path.description: Marked true if this place record is part of a path of places, such as a GPS breadcrumb path.  For example, Google Latitude is a path, Foursquare is not.

title.description: The name of the location for this place (if available).

via.description: The relative URL for retrieving original object.

available.description: An array of service manifest entries for all of the available services.

installed.description: An object of the currently installed services and their internal state.
